repository.corpname: M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: State University of New York at Albany. Office of University Relations

did.abstract: Contains records form the Office of University Relations and its predecessors, including the Office of Public Relations and Office of Community Relations.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Series-level processing completed in 2019 by Miles Lawlor.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted because it is unprocessed. Portions of the collection may contain recent administrative records and/or personally identifiable information. Please contact an archivist for more information.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: This page may contain links to digital objects. Access to these images and the technical capacity to download them does not imply permission for re-use. Digital objects may be used freely for personal reference use, referred to, or linked to from other web sites. Researchers do not have permission to publish or disseminate material from these collections without permission from an archivist and/or the copyright holder. The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming to the laws of copyright. Some materials in these collections may be protected by the U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) and/or by the copyright or neighboring-rights laws of other nations. More information about U.S. Copyright is provided by the Copyright Office. Additionally, re-use may be restricted by terms of University Libraries gift or purchase agreements, donor restrictions, privacy and publicity rights, licensing and trademarks. The University Archives are eager to hear from any copyright owners who are not properly identified so that appropriate information may be provided in the future.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: All items in this collection were transferred to the University Libraries, M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The collection has been organized into five series. The first series is made up of subject files and administrative files maintained by the office. The second series includes press releases that the office produced from various publications. The third series includes a file of publications produced by the office for various entities throughout the University. The fourth series documents the schools athletic teams. The fifth series is made up of photographs and photographic materials, while the sixth and final series is made up of press clippings that the office retained from various publications.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows: Identification of specific item, series, box, folder, University Relations, 1960-1994. M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University Libraries, University at Albany, State University of New York (hereafter referred to as the University Relations).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains materials created by the Office of University Relations and several of its predecessor and subordinate offices, including: the Office of Community Relations, the Public Relations Office, and the News Bureau.
Materials include: University publications; press releases; clippings; CRO logs; sports files that include press releases, season schedules, brochures, statistics, and clippings; and budget files.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The University's Public Relations Office, responsible for press releases and public information, was created circa 1961. In the late 1960s, it became the Office of Community Relations, which was incorporated into the newly-formed Office of University Affairs in 1972. The title changed again when it became the Office of University Relations (sometime prior to 1985), although, somewhat confusingly, there was a brief period in the 1990s when the Office of Community Relations was reintroduced and existed alongside the Office of University Relations. From 1990 through circa 2005, the Office of University Relations was administered by the Division of University Advancement. As of 2017, public information and media relations are managed by the Office of Communications and Marketing.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Files in this series have been ordered based upon original box labels.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series is made up of subject files the office maintained on university events that it promoted, such as research conferences, speaking engagements, building dedications and artistic performances. This series contains files as well on individuals and organizations that the office had contact with, inluding legislators and student groups. These files contain press releases, copies of advertisements placed in local publications as well as correspondence.
This series also contains administrative records maintained by the Office. These mostly include office memoranda related to events covered by the office.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Original boxes for records in this series were labelled as "subject files," "press clippings," and "press clipping subject files. As the files themselves appear to have served the same purpose and were often already interfiled, they are presented as a single records series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series is made up of press releases issued by the Office and its predecessors. The vast majority of this series is made up of chronological files maintained by the office of press releases, with some of these files also containing press clippings.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Files in this series have been maintained in their original order upon transfer. Files in this series were arranged chronologically, [with duplicate files placed at the end?].

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Materials in boxes 1-3 have been arranged so that each folder contains all the press releases produced in a given month.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Files have been maintained in their original order upon processing and are largely arranged alphabetically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series appears to have served as a reference file of university-related publications maintained by the Office. These include publications created by interest groups affiliated with the school (such as New York Environmental News) and promotional materials created by the school itself (such as admissions mailers).
Additionally, the collection includes a chronological collection of the University Update, which was published at the time by the University Relations Office.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series is made up of files maintained by the Office on the university's athletic programs. Files in this series document competitions and coaching hires of the university's varsity as well as junior varsity athletic teams, with a focus on men's basketball and football. This series contains press releases and press clippings, team statistics and schedules, and publications including game-day programs and press guides. It also contains correspondence from the period in which the school transitioned to Division I athletics.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Files in this series have largely been order based upon original writing and labels on storage boxes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series is made up of photographs and negative sheets. The photographs and negative sheets in this series document various University events and appear to have been taken either for or by employees of the office. The collection includes a mix of posed and candid photographs of students and faculty as well as photographs of major events including graduation ceremonies.

At one time the office appears to have been responsible for the creation of the Carillon and UAlbany Magazine; as such, some of the files in this series contain photographs and graphics prepared for the magazine.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Files in this series have been maintained in their original order upon transfer. Most photographic files were arranged alphabetically by subject.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Files in this series have been maintained in their original order. The appear to have been primarily ordered chronologically by publication type.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series is made up of files of press clippings that the Office maintained. These files primarily document press coverage in campus publications such as the Tower Tribune and in local newspapers in the Greater Albany area, but coverage of the university in national publications such as the New York Times and Time appear as well.
